FY2021.Q31: The mission of the New York State Mesonet (NYSM) is to serve the state of New York by providing the best meteorological data, the best products, and the best services possible with the goal of saving lives and property while building a smart weather economy. At its core, the NYSM is a highly dedicated, cross-disciplinary team aspiring to set the worldwide standard of excellence for data quality. With its unique focus on research to operations, preventive maintenance, and state-of-the-art quality control efforts, the NYSM utilizes these high quality weather data to create end products designed to improve forecast accuracy, reduce uncertainty, and mitigate harm.
FY2021.Q32: The vision of the New York State Mesonet is to become a national center, collaborating with government, academic, and commercial partners, to educate and solve real-world problems in agriculture, emergency management, energy, public health, and transportation, improving the well being and livelihood for all.
FY2021.Q71: 1. Operate and maintain all 222 statewide weather stations of the NYS Mesonet during 2020 - 2021 with a combined 97.5%+ uptime.
FY2021.Q72:
(a) Continued improvement in data quality control software.
(b) Continued training of field staff.
(c) Continued sensor rotation of aging sensors and equipment.
FY2021.Q73: All data are archived and daily statistics are compiled to record the percentage of all data received in real-time.  We have a detailed record of all station uptime percentages for all periods.
FY2021.Q76: Significant loss of funding during 2021, which would require a reduction in staff.  This would directly impact the speed at which sensors are repaired and/or replaced.
FY2021.Q77: ASRC and DAES.  Both organizations provide critical in-kind technical and administrative support.
FY2021.Q78:
Federal funding to the NYS Mesonet via the National Mesonet Program requires a network uptime of at least 95%.  So this metric ensures that this federal flow-through money continues.  
Furthermore, this metric ensures that the NYS Mesonet provides the highest quality and most complete data set to support numerous other research grants on campus.
FY2021.Q81: To lead and support grant sponsored research of at least $1 million during the 2020-2021 season.
FY2021.Q82:
(a) Lead the writing of several proposals to federal and state RFPs.
(b) Aid UAlbany and external NYS Mesonet partners in support of their proposals.  
(c) Expand and deepen ongoing collaborations.
FY2021.Q83:
(a) Track the number of proposals submitted from the NYS Mesonet.
(b) Track the amount of grant funding from federal, state, and other sources.
(c) Track the number of proposals including NYS Mesonet funding.
FY2021.Q86: A reduction in NYS Mesonet funding or staff changes.
FY2021.Q87: DAES and ASRC, as they provide technical and administrative support to the Mesonet.
FY2021.Q88: This goal supports and encourages innovative research opportunities.
FY2021.Q91: Expand NYS Mesonet communications through increased peer-reviewed publications and media.
FY2021.Q92:
(a) Make peer-reviewed journal writing a specific focus for some research activities. 
(b) Expand web/Facebook/Twitter presence.
(c) Expand media opportunities for the Mesonet.
FY2021.Q93:
1. Track the number of journal articles submitted for peer review.
2. Track the number of formal publications referencing Mesonet.
3. Track the number of followers on Facebook/Twitter/web.
4. Track the number and frequency of media stories following Mesonet.
FY2021.Q96: A reduction in NYS Mesonet funding and or staff changes.
FY2021.Q98: This goal support innovative research activities by expanding our user base and expanding our collaborative opportunities with both internal and external partners.
FY2021.FY2021Mission: The mission of the New York State Mesonet (NYSM) is to serve the state of New York by providing the best meteorological data, the best products, and the best services possible with the goal of saving lives and property while building a smart weather economy. At its core, the NYSM is a highly dedicated, cross-disciplinary team aspiring to set the worldwide standard of excellence for data quality. With its unique focus on research to operations, preventive maintenance, and state-of-the-art quality control efforts, the NYSM utilizes these high quality weather data to create end products designed to improve forecast accuracy, reduce uncertainty, and mitigate harm. In collaboration with government, academic, and commercial partners, the NYSM is solving real-world problems in agriculture, emergency management, energy, public health, and transportation, improving the well being and livelihood of all.
FY2021.FY2021Goal1: 1. Operate and maintain all 222 statewide weather stations of the NYS Mesonet during 2020 - 2021 with a combined 97.5%+ uptime.
FY2021.FY2021Action1:
(a) Continued improvement in data quality control software.
(b) Continued training of field staff.
(c) Continued sensor rotation of aging sensors and equipment.
FY2021.FY2021Metric1: All data are archived and daily statistics are compiled to record the percentage of all data received in real-time.  We have a detailed record of all station uptime percentages for all periods.
FY2021.FY2021Goal2: To lead and support grant sponsored research of at least $1 million during the 2020-2021 season.
FY2021.FY2021Action2:
(a) Lead the writing of several proposals to federal and state RFPs.
(b) Aid UAlbany and external NYS Mesonet partners in support of their proposals.  
(c) Expand and deepen ongoing collaborations.
FY2021.FY2021Metric2:
(a) Track the number of proposals submitted from the NYS Mesonet.
(b) Track the amount of grant funding from federal, state, and other sources.
(c) Track the number of proposals including NYS Mesonet funding.
FY2021.FY2021Goal3: Expand NYS Mesonet communications through increased peer-reviewed publications and media.
FY2021.FY2021Action3:
(a) Make peer-reviewed journal writing a specific focus for some research activities. 
(b) Expand web/Facebook/Twitter presence.
(c) Expand media opportunities for the Mesonet.
FY2021.FY2021Metric3:
1. Track the number of journal articles submitted for peer review.
2. Track the number of formal publications referencing Mesonet.
3. Track the number of followers on Facebook/Twitter/web.
4. Track the number and frequency of media stories following Mesonet.
